OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the necessity of a knee replacement procedure based on the patient's knee pain and mobility issues.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of osteoarthritis in the knee, gradually worsening over the past 3 years.

X-Ray.Findings: Joint space narrowing and osteophyte formation in the knee

OSCE_Examination.Correct_Diagnosis: Severe osteoarthritis of the knee requiring knee replacement

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: To diagnose long-sightedness and recommend appropriate treatment options.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Adult, aged 40 or older, with potential visual complaints.
Patient_Actor.History: Patient reports difficulty seeing nearby objects clearly and has a family history of vision issues.

Secondary_Symptoms: Eyes feel tired after close-up tasks such as reading or using a computer.

Eye Test.Findings: Difficulty focusing on near objects, possibly indicative of hypermetropia.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: To assess the patient's symptoms and determine the presence and severity of sleep apnoea.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient reports difficulty sleeping and excessive daytime fatigue. Family history of sleep apnoea.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Breathing stops and starts while sleeping.
Secondary_Symptoms: Gasping, snorting, or choking noises during sleep

Sleep Study (Polysomnography).Findings: AHI score of 22, indicating moderate obstructive sleep apnoea.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose a patient suspected of having hepatitis B.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently returned from travel to a high-risk country; reports potential exposure to hepatitis B through unprotected sexual contact.

Ultrasound.Findings: Normal liver size, no lesions detected

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess for signs of craniosynostosis in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Infant or young child, age range typically under 1 year.
Patient_Actor.History: Family history of craniosynostosis or other cranial deformities may be relevant. Monitor head shape and development.

X-ray.Findings: May show abnormal skull shape and sutures, depending on type of craniosynostosis.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose a patient with suspected respiratory tract infection (RTI).

Patient_Actor.History: Patient reports experiencing respiratory symptoms over the past week, with no significant past medical history.

Chest X-ray.Findings: No signs of pneumonia, clear lung fields

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage potential kidney disease in a patient with diabetes using urine albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) testing.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Adult patient with a recent diabetes diagnosis.
Patient_Actor.History: Recently diagnosed with diabetes; no prior history of kidney disease.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Concern about kidney function due to diabetes.

OSCE_Examination.Correct_Diagnosis: Early-stage kidney disease due to diabetes.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and provide treatment options for a baby with nappy rash.

Patient_Actor.History: Recent onset of nappy rash with no previous history of skin conditions.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Red or raw patches on the bottom or nappy area
Secondary_Symptoms: Sore skin that feels hot to touch
Spots or pimples on the bottom

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient for signs of an infected pilonidal sinus and determine appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a history of recurrent pilonidal sinus infections. Previous episodes treated with antibiotics.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain and swelling at the top of the cleft in the buttocks

Ultrasound.Findings: Presence of a fluid collection indicating an abscess

OSCE_Examination.Correct_Diagnosis: Infected pilonidal sinus with abscess formation

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose postural tachycardia syndrome (PoTS) in the patient.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Adult, gender unspecified, possibly experiencing PoTS symptoms.
Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with symptoms that may suggest postural tachycardia syndrome. History may include long covid, myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS), or joint hypermobility syndrome.

Vital_Signs.Blood_Pressure: Measured before and after standing, specific values N/A
Vital_Signs.Heart_Rate: Increased heart rate upon standing, specific values N/A

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's condition and discuss the necessity of a mastectomy for breast cancer treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a family history of breast cancer and was recently diagnosed with invasive breast cancer. She has no previous surgeries.

Mammogram.Findings: Mass in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast; suggestive of malignancy.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose a suspected case of soft tissue sarcoma.

Patient_Actor.History: No significant past medical history, slight weight gain over the past year, no previous cancer diagnosis.

MRI.Findings: A 5 cm mass in the soft tissue of the left arm with irregular borders.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient for signs and symptoms of a stroke and provide appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient may have a history of hypertension, diabetes, or previous transient ischemic attacks (TIAs).

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Sudden onset of weakness or numbness, particularly on one side of the body.
Secondary_Symptoms: Severe headache with no known cause

CT Scan.Findings: Possible ischemic changes or hemorrhage in the brain

OSCE_Examination.Correct_Diagnosis: Stroke (Ischemic or Hemorrhagic depending on imaging findings)

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient suspected of having type 2 diabetes.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Adult, potentially overweight, with a family history of diabetes.
Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a sedentary lifestyle and reports increased thirst and fatigue.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose potential astigmatism in the patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has not had an eye test in over 2 years and has been experiencing vision issues.

Secondary_Symptoms: Eye strain after prolonged use of computer

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a child suspected of having bronchiolitis.

Patient_Actor.History: Recent cold symptoms followed by worsening respiratory distress.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of hand pain.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Adult patient, age unspecified, gender unspecified.
Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with localized pain in the hand. Specific area of pain needs to be identified (wrist, finger, thumb, palm, or back of the hand).

Secondary_Symptoms: Swelling or tenderness in the affected area
